survey.title: Tell us about your experience with letters from the authorities

consent.title: Consent
consent.text: I agree that my answers will only be used for this project. They will be deleted after the project. I don't need to give my name or e-mail address if I don't want to. Do you agree?

frequency.question: How often do you have to deal with authorities such as the job center, immigration office or youth welfare office?

scenarioLetter.question: Imagine this: You receive a letter from the immigration office. What do you do first?

options.self: I read it myself and understand it most of the time
options.ask: I read it, but I have to ask someone
options.photo: I send a photo via WhatsApp
options.help: I go to the advice center
options.waitForHelp: I wait until I meet someone
options.wait: I put it aside for now

challengeLetter.question: What is the most difficult part?

options.knowledge: Know what I have to do
options.getHelp: I don't know where to get help
options.fear: I immediately get scared that there is a problem

scenarioAppointments.question: Just imagine: You need an appointment at the citizens' office. What do you do?

options.getHelp: I ask someone to help me
options.wait: I'll postpone it / do it later

challengeAppointments.question: What is the most difficult part?

options.language: Explain in German that I need an appointment
options.findInfomation: The contact details of the authority can be found
options.fear: I'm scared because I don't know what to expect at the appointment

scenarioForm.question: Imagine this: You have to fill out an application for cost coverage at the job center. What do you do?

options.walkIn: I fill it out with the help of someone
options.wait: I use an app or online help
options.online: I go to the advice center

challengeForm.question: What is the most difficult part?

options.digital: Fill out a form on your cell phone or computer
options.attachments: Know which documents I need to enclose
options.fear: I am very afraid that I might make mistakes

helpSource.question: Who usually helps you with official matters?

missedDeadline.question: Have you ever missed something important (deadline, appointment) because you didn't understand a letter?

organization.question: How do you organize your important documents?

options.folder: I have a folder at home
options.bag: I keep everything in a bag/drawer
options.photos: I take photos with my cell phone

organizationSuccess.question: How well do you organize your documents?

options.sometimes: I have to search for a long time, but I usually find it
options.help: I can't find documents without help

appPriorities.question: Imagine this: An app helps you with letters. What is most important to you?

options.privacy: My data remains private and will not be passed on
options.free: The app is free of charge
options.multilingual: I can use the app in my language
options.guidance: The app tells me what I need to do
options.organization: I can sort my documents there

perfectHelp.question: Do you have any ideas on how an app could help you with official matters?

email.question: Share your e-mail with us so that we can keep you informed about the project

thanks.title: Thank you very much! üôè
thanks.message: Your answers will help us to develop an app that is really useful.
